guides.title: Wolfpack Welcome Week
guides.description: Your complete guide to Welcome Week! Find events, locations, must-do tasks, and everything you need to start your NC State journey.

todos.title: Pick up your Wolfpack One Card
todos.description: Your student ID is required for dining, building access, and events

todos.title: Download the TransLoc app
todos.description: Track Wolfline buses in real-time to get around campus

todos.title: Complete online orientation modules
todos.description: Required modules must be done before Welcome Week

todos.title: Attend Opening Ceremony
todos.description: Welcome from Chancellor and student leaders at Reynolds Coliseum

todos.title: Meet with your Academic Advisor
todos.description: Confirm your class schedule and ask questions

todos.title: Attend your Floor Meeting
todos.description: Meet your RA and hall mates, learn about dorm policies

events.title: Opening Ceremony
events.description: Official welcome from university leadership, student speakers, and the Wolfpack spirit squad!

events.title: Campus Resource Fair
events.description: Meet student organizations, campus services, and find ways to get involved

events.title: Welcome Dinner
events.description: Free dinner for all new students. Meet your classmates!

events.title: Academic Success Workshop
events.description: Study strategies, time management, and tips from successful students

events.title: Student Org Showcase
events.description: Discover 600+ student organizations and find your community

events.title: Rec Center Open House
events.description: Tour the gym, try group fitness, meet the rec staff

events.title: Wolfpack Traditions Night
events.description: Learn about NC State traditions at the iconic Memorial Belltower

events.title: First Home Football Game
events.description: NC State vs. Western Carolina - Student tickets are FREE!

locations.name: Reynolds Coliseum
locations.description: Historic arena, home of Opening Ceremony

locations.name: Talley Student Union
locations.description: Campus hub with dining, meeting rooms, and student services

locations.name: D.H. Hill Jr. Library
locations.description: Main campus library with study spaces and tutoring

locations.name: Carmichael Gym
locations.description: Recreation center with gym, pool, and fitness classes

locations.name: Memorial Belltower
locations.description: Iconic NC State landmark and gathering spot

faqs.question: What should I wear to Opening Ceremony?
faqs.answer: Wear red and white to show your Wolfpack spirit! Casual attire is fine. The event is indoors and air-conditioned.

faqs.question: How do I get to events without a car?
faqs.answer: The Wolfline bus system is free for students! Download the TransLoc app to track buses in real-time. Most Welcome Week events are on main campus and walkable.

faqs.question: Are meals included during Welcome Week?
faqs.answer: Several free meals are provided, including the Welcome Dinner. If you have a meal plan, your dining halls are open. Check event descriptions for free food!

faqs.question: What if I miss an event?
faqs.answer: Most events are optional except Opening Ceremony. Don't worry if you miss something - there are lots of ways to get involved throughout the semester!

faqs.question: Where can I park during Welcome Week?
faqs.answer: Visitor parking is available in the Coliseum Deck and Partner's Way Deck. Students living on campus should use their assigned lot. Consider taking the Wolfline!

updates.title: Opening Ceremony Location Confirmed
updates.message: Opening Ceremony will be held at Reynolds Coliseum. Doors open at 9:30 AM!

sections.title: What to Bring
sections.content: Pack light for Welcome Week events! Essentials: your phone, student ID (or confirmation), water bottle, and comfortable walking shoes. Most venues are air-conditioned, but outdoor events can be hot!

sections.title: Getting Around Campus
sections.content: NC State's campus is very walkable, but the Wolfline bus system is free and convenient. Download TransLoc to track buses. Bike racks are available at most buildings.

guides.title: Housing & Move-In
guides.description: Everything you need for a smooth move-in experience. Check off tasks, find your hall, and get settled in your new home!

todos.title: Confirm your move-in time slot
todos.description: Check your email for your assigned move-in date and time

todos.title: Review what to bring (and what NOT to bring)
todos.description: Check the packing list to avoid bringing prohibited items

todos.title: Complete roommate agreement
todos.description: Work with your roommate to set expectations

todos.title: Attend your floor meeting
todos.description: Meet your RA and neighbors, learn hall policies

todos.title: Set up your meal plan
todos.description: Make sure your dining plan is active

events.title: Early Move-In (Special Populations)
events.description: Athletes, international students, and approved early arrivals

events.title: General Move-In Day 1
events.description: Last names A-L move in today

events.title: General Move-In Day 2
events.description: Last names M-Z move in today

locations.name: Sullivan Hall
locations.description: First-year residence hall on East Campus

locations.name: Housing Office
locations.description: Main housing office for questions and key pickup

faqs.question: What size sheets do I need?
faqs.answer: All residence hall beds are Twin XL (extra long). Standard twin sheets will be too short!

faqs.question: Can I bring a microwave or mini-fridge?
faqs.answer: Micro-fridges are provided in most halls. Personal microwaves and large fridges are not allowed. Check your specific hall's policies.

faqs.question: Where do I pick up my room key?
faqs.answer: Check in at your residence hall's front desk. Bring your student ID or confirmation email.

faqs.question: Can my family help me move in?
faqs.answer: Yes! Each student can bring helpers. Move-in volunteers will be available with carts. Families should plan to leave by evening for floor meetings.

links.title: Packing List
links.description: What to bring and what to leave

sections.title: What to Bring
sections.content: Essentials: Twin XL bedding, towels, toiletries, desk lamp, power strip (with surge protector), hangers, laundry basket, and school supplies. Don't forget your student ID!

sections.title: What NOT to Bring
sections.content: Prohibited items: candles, incense, hot plates, space heaters, halogen lamps, pets (except fish in small tanks), and weapons of any kind. Large furniture is also not allowed.

sections.title: Move-In Day Tips
sections.content: Arrive during your assigned time slot. Park in designated move-in zones (temporary parking only). Use the move-in carts and volunteers! Get your key first, then unload.

guides.title: Campus Safety
guides.description: Stay safe on campus. Emergency contacts, safety resources, and tips for navigating campus day and night.

todos.title: Save Campus Police number in your phone
Download the WolfAlert app
todos.description: Get emergency notifications and access safety features

todos.title: Register for Emergency Notifications
todos.description: Make sure your contact info is current in MyPack Portal

faqs.question: What should I do in an emergency?
faqs.answer: Call 911 for life-threatening emergencies. For non-emergencies on campus, call Campus Police at 919-515-3000. Blue light emergency phones are located throughout campus.

faqs.question: Is there a safe ride service at night?
faqs.answer: Yes! The Wolfpack Patrol offers free safety escorts on campus. Call 919-515-3000 to request one. The service runs from dusk until dawn.

faqs.question: Where are the blue light phones?
faqs.answer: Blue light emergency phones are located throughout campus, especially in parking lots and along walkways. Press the button to connect directly to Campus Police.

sections.title: Walking Alone at Night
sections.content: Stay on well-lit paths. Use the buddy system when possible. Keep your phone charged. Know where blue light phones are located. Request a Wolfpack Patrol escort for free.

sections.title: Protect Your Belongings
sections.content: Never leave laptops or bags unattended. Lock your dorm room even when you're home. Register your bike with Campus Police. Don't leave valuables visible in your car.
